issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I found in cloud-debug.log:

  

Fri Sep 9 14:49:43 2011  INFO [X509Download:30535209@qtp-32177614-9 - /getX509
?account=eucalyptus&user=admin&code=DDSOGhaQ2QpOnBasJjU7fxK0TTeDkB8hwavAotdxgh
6fuBYBUHpaijoa2IDRxCeH6uNy4XWd78K3R2oRnjrw]
[edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.admin.server.X509Download.doGet(X509Download.java):139]
pushing out the X509 certificate for user admin

  
Resending this string in a request to CLC would allow anyone, who has read
access to cloud-debug.log on CLC (right now it's any user on that machine), to
download admin's credentials for eucalyptus.
fields.summary: clc should not log the request to get credentials

comments.body:
Originally posted on 2011-09-09 22:24:22 by rusvika

Fri Sep 09 15:24:21 2011: Request 3435 was acted upon.
 Transaction: Ticket created by vika.felmetsger
       Queue: Engineering Bugs
     Subject: clc should not log the request to get credentials
       Owner: Nobody
  Requestors: Vika.Felmetsger@eucalyptus.com
      Status: new
 Ticket <URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=3435 >


I found in cloud-debug.log:

Fri Sep 9 14:49:43 2011 INFO [X509Download:30535209@qtp-32177614-9 -
/getX509?account=eucalyptus&user=admin&code=DDSOGhaQ2QpOnBasJjU7fxK0TTeDkB8hwavAotdxgh6fuBYBUHpaijoa2IDRxCeH6uNy4XWd78K3R2oRnjrw]
[edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.admin.server.X509Download.doGet(X509Download.java):139]
pushing out the X509 certificate for user admin
Resending this string in a request to CLC would allow anyone, who has read
access to cloud-debug.log on CLC (right now it's any user on that machine), to
download admin's credentials for eucalyptus.

Originally posted on 2011-09-12 18:14:22

Mon Sep 12 11:14:22 2011: Request 3435 was acted upon.
 Transaction: Given to vika.felmetsger by dan.nurmi
       Queue: Engineering Bugs
     Subject: clc should not log the request to get credentials
       Owner: vika.felmetsger
  Requestors: Vika.Felmetsger@eucalyptus.com
      Status: new
 Ticket <URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=3435 >


This transaction appears to have no content

Originally posted on 2011-09-12 20:02:41 by rusvika
I have confirmed that anyone can download the credential using this string
from the log. For example, accessing:

  
https://<clc-ip>:8443/ getX509? account=eucalyptus&user=admin&code=DDSOGhaQ2Qp
OnBasJjU7fxK0TTeDkB8hwavAotdxgh6fuBYBUHpaijoa2IDRxCeH6uNy4XWd78K3R2oRnjrw

  
will download admin's credentials without any problems (or authentication).

  
This problem is similar to RT#2567. If the code in the URL is made a one-time-
only authentication token (i.e., a subsequent request using the same code will
not succeed), both problems will be solved.

  
On Fri Sep 09 15:24:21 2011, vika.felmetsger wrote:

> I found in cloud-debug.log:

>

> Fri Sep 9 14:49:43 2011 INFO [X509Download:30535209@qtp-32177614-9 -

> /getX509?account=eucalyptus&user=admin&code=DDSOGhaQ2QpOnBasJjU7fxK0TTeDkB8h
wavAotdxgh6fuBYBUHpaijoa2IDRxCeH6uNy4XWd78K3R2oRnjrw]

> [edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.admin.server.X509Download.doGet(X509Download.java):139]

> pushing out the X509 certificate for user admin

> Resending this string in a request to CLC would allow anyone, who has

> read

> access to cloud-debug.log on CLC (right now it's any user on that

> machine), to

> download admin's credentials for eucalyptus.

Originally posted on 2011-09-12 20:02:41 by admin
https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=3435 This is a comment.
It is not sent to the Requestor(s): I have confirmed that anyone can download
the credential using this string from the log. For example, accessing:
https://:8443/ getX509? account=eucalyptus&user;=admin&code;=DDSOGhaQ2QpOnBasJ
jU7fxK0TTeDkB8hwavAotdxgh6fuBYBUHpaijoa2IDRxCeH6uNy4XWd78K3R2oRnjrw will
download admin's credentials without any problems (or authentication). This
problem is similar to RT#2567. If the code in the URL is made a one-time-only
authentication token (i.e., a subsequent request using the same code will not
succeed), both problems will be solved. On Fri Sep 09 15:24:21 2011,
vika.felmetsger wrote: > I found in cloud-debug.log: > > Fri Sep 9 14:49:43
2011 INFO [X509Download:30535209@qtp-32177614-9 - > /getX509?account=eucalyptu
s&user;=admin&code;=DDSOGhaQ2QpOnBasJjU7fxK0TTeDkB8hwavAotdxgh6fuBYBUHpaijoa2I
DRxCeH6uNy4XWd78K3R2oRnjrw] >
[edu.ucsb.eucalyptus.admin.server.X509Download.doGet(X509Download.java):139] >
pushing out the X509 certificate for user admin > Resending this string in a
request to CLC would allow anyone, who has > read > access to cloud-debug.log
on CLC (right now it's any user on that > machine), to > download admin's
credentials for eucalyptus.

On Mon, Sep 12, 2011 at 1:02 PM, Vika Felmetsger via RT <bugs@support.eucalyptus.com> wrote:

https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=3435
This is a comment. It is not sent to the Requestor(s):

I have confirmed that anyone can download the credential using this string from
the log. For example, accessing:

https://:8443/ getX509?
account=eucalyptus&user=admin&code=DDSOGhaQ2QpOnBasJjU7fxK0TTeDkB8hwavAotdxgh6fuBYBUHpaijoa2IDRxCeH6uNy4XWd78K3R2oRnjrw

will download admin's credentials without any problems (or authentication).

This problem is similar to RT#2567. If the code in the URL is made a
one-time-only authentication token (i.e., a subsequent request using the same
code will not succeed), both problems will be solved.
